question: Which nation houses the "Rhodopes Mountains"?
explanation: The Rhodopes Mountains are located in the southern European nation Bulgaria. Golyam Perelik is its highest peak. These mountains are featured by montane mixed forests and temperate broadleaf and mixed forests biome. Trigrad Gorge, a canyon of vertical marble rocks, formed due to Karst processes is located in this mountain range. This mountain range is also an important hydropower source for Bulgaria. It forms the oldest landmass of the Balkan Peninsula.
